profile.title: Hello!
body: Hello! My name is Joe. I'm a Software Developer based in the Midwest.
I enjoy working at any and all levels of the software stack. My current interests lie in full-stack application development, but I'm open to working with all types of technologies.
Here are some technologies I've worked with recently:

education.summary: I've continued my education through various resources resources including Udemy, books, and more. My most recent experience was finishing a full-stack ReactJS + NodeJS developer course through Udemy.

After Butler, I took a semester off to teach myself Python to test the waters of the programming world. After finding how much I enjoyed programming, I enrolled at Kansas State University to further my education. At KSU, my education was challenging and comprehensive, but also very rewarding. The instructors there were an essential component of establishing the core foundation I continue to build on today.

I attended Butler Community College on scholarship directly after high school. Initially studying Liberal Arts, I tried my hand at a few different majors before choosing Mathematics. Growing up, I was always curious about how stuff works. Studying Mathematics gave me the skillset and a common language needed to further my education in any engineering or science field. This was an excellent experience, as it provided a solid foundation for my education to come.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.summary: After graduation, I joined the engineering team at NetApp. I primarily worked with Python and TypeScript, but was exposed to many different technologies. In the face of ever-evolving product requirements in a fast-paced environment, I always managed to deliver on my commitments. NetApp was a rewarding first step in my career because it exposed me to a wide array of technologies while fostering personal and professional growth.
experience.responsibilities: Software development, software testing, and project scoping on a HCI Deployment Engine.

experience.title: Lead of Development
experience.summary: During my time at K-State, I worked in the Information Technology Assistance Center as an IT Consultant. I was given the opportunity to lead a team of developers in building new solutions to replace antiquated tools and technologies. My time at iTAC was a great experience because it allowed me to grow as a developer while assisting those around me.
experience.responsibilities: Software research and development, IT technical support, and new-hire training.

experience.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant
experience.summary: While attending K-State, I worked as an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in the Department of Computer Science. Educating students in Computer Science was an incredibly rewarding experience because it allowed me to witness and be a part of their journey to become great Computer Scientists.
experience.responsibilities: Assisted instructors with in-class activities, graded class assignments, and tutored students on the fundamentals of programming using Python.

projects.title: Personal Website
projects.summary: This is a personal website / portfolio I designed and built using primarily React and styled-components. To get more experience with styled-components and CSS, I didn't use frameworks like Bootstrap or Material-UI

projects.title: Crown Clothing
projects.summary: This is an e-commerce site I made as a final project in a Udemy course. I built it primarily with React, Redux, and Express.js.

projects.title: What's the Weather?
projects.summary: This is one of the first apps I made with React. I built it primarily with React, Express.js and the OpenWeather API.
